page.title: 06TIGER'S BAY
page.content:
Tiger's Bay was a village really- five narrow streets fitting neatly into the jigsaw of N.Belfast. We had our school and post office. There was a Tiger's Bay handy woman who attended at childbirths and in the house opposite ours there was a very old woman who laid out and washed the dead. A man in our street did carpentry work for the village, and also an old Jewish refugee from Russia replaced our broken windows. The ministers of the church were very important people in our lives. The whole family knelt on the stone floor and joined in prayer to mark the end of a minister's visit to the house.
N.Ireland Adult Literacy Liaison Group c/o Dept. of Education Bangor Co. Down
